name: POSTAL SERVICE v. FLAMINGO INDUSTRIES (USA) LTD.
reasoning: The Postal Service, in both form and function, is not a separate antitrust person from the United States. It is part of the Government of the United States and so is not controlled by the antitrust laws.

name: Cullinan
reasoning: The Post Office Department had nonpostal lines of business, such as money orders and postal savings accounts.

name: Revenue, Pieces, and Weight by Classes of Mail and Special Services for Government Fiscal Year 2003
reasoning: The great majority of the organization's business, however, consists of postal services.

name: ยง 403(a)
reasoning: In which it may seek profits to offset losses in the postal business.
